required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neoadjuvant Therapy With Proxalutamide Combined With Androgen Deprivation Therapy（ADT）for High Risk Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled, Double-blind, Single Center，Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Neoadjuvant Therapy With Proxalutamide Combined With Androgen Deprivation Therapy（ADT）for High Risk Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.source: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

brief_summary.textblock: This trial aims to evaluate the efficacy and safety of neoadjuvant therapy with Proxalutamide combined with androgen deprivation therapy（ADT）for High risk prostate cancer ，This trial is A randomized, controlled, double-blind, single center.Treatment cycle is 6 months,

primary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects with no morphologically recognizable cancer cell in tumor specimens after radical prostatectomy

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects With Minimal Residual Disease
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects that have residual tumors with maximum diameter of 3 mm or less after radical prostatectomy

intervention.description: placebo+ADT（Androgen Deprivation Therapy） ，Route of placebo administration: tablet, dosage：300mg , dosage form oral , frequency of administration：QD
Proxalutamide +ADT（Androgen Deprivation Therapy） ，Route of Proxalutamide administration: tablet, dosage：300mg , dosage form oral , frequency of administration：QD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients must participate voluntarily and sign an informed consent form (ICF), indicating that they understand the purpose and required procedures of the study
2. Patients must be ≥ 18，male
3. Histopathological by Prostate biopsy confirmed prostatic cancer（No Neuroendocrine prostate cancer or small cell carcinoma）
4. High-risk prostate cancer (T2c≤ clinical stage ≤T4 or Gleason score ≥8 or PSA≥20ng/ml)
5. Patients willing to undergo laparoscopic radical resection of prostate cancer and extensive lymph node dissection
6. ECOG PS：0-1
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Imaging or biopsy confirmed distant Metastatic lesion
2. The number of regional lymph nodes metastasis >3
3. Patients had undergone The treatment of Systemic chemotherapy and endocrine therapy for prostate cancer
4. Patients had undergone prostate surgery、radical radiotherapy or Bilateral orchidectomy

overall_official.affiliation: Study Chair Department of Urology, Drum Tower Hospital, Medical School of Nanjing University

facility.name: The Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School
